qas.question: In what year did Pius XII deliver a radio address announcing Montini's papal appointment?
In what year did Montini become the archbishop of the Cathedral of Milan?
On what date did Montini become the archbishop of Milan?
To what Italian city was Montini appointed archbishop?
Where was Pius XII when he announced Montini's appointment as archbishop?

context: Pius XII delivered an address about Montini's appointment from <a4_0>his sick-bed<a4_0/> over radio to those assembled in St. Peter's Basilica on 12 December <a0_0>1954<a0_0/>. Both Montini and the pope had tears in their eyes when Montini parted for his dioceses with 1,000 churches, 2,500 priests and 3,500,000 souls. On <a2_0>5 January<a2_0/> <a1_0>1955<a1_0/>, Montini formally took possession of his Cathedral of Milan. Montini, after a period of preparation, liked his new tasks as archbishop, connecting to all groups of faithful in <a3_0>Milan<a3_0/>. He enjoyed meetings with intellectuals, artists and writers.
